what: Using match_stopwords() to remove stop words
title: A Guide to Using the Package
text: match_stopwords() function processes user reviews removing predefined stopwords preserving original rating scores. takes dataframe “comment” “rating” columns, cleans review filtering stopwords custom stopword lists stopwords-iso, returns dataframe additional cleaned_text column analysis. function helps text normalization sentiment analysis rating-based insights. demonstrate practical analytical use case preprocessed review data package’s function work together real analysis workflow given examples. example calculates longer reviews correlate higher/lower ratings. function can applied another sample dataset well. English translations text comment cleaned_text columns output given :
code: cleaned_reviews <- match_stopwords(reviews)  # Remove stopwords  cleaned_reviews |>       group_by(rating) |>      summarise(avg_text_length = mean(nchar(cleaned_text))) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   rating avg_text_length ##    <dbl>           <dbl> ## 1      1            65.7 ## 2      2            59.8 ## 3      3            52.7 ## 4      4            48.0 ## 5      5            43.1 reviews_sample <- tibble(     comment = c(       "Bu ürün xs ancak fiyatı yüksek gibi",        "Fiyat çok pahalı ama kaliteli iyi"     ),      rating = c(4.5, 3.0) )  cleaned_sample <- match_stopwords(reviews_sample) # comment                                                     # [1] "This product is xs but seems realy expensive"             # [2] "The price is not very expensive it's high-quality good"   # cleaned_text # [1] "the product price high"  # [2] "the price expensive high-quality"
